commit_list.message:
Initial commit

This initializes the repo

Replaces slideshow.js and styles.css content with content from my repo

I’m not sure where the code for your .js and .css files came from, but
simply copying my code and pasting it whole cloth into your files fixed
99% of the problems. Your .js file had some really weird jQuery code in
it…really not sure where that came from…

Fixed stylesheet linking

Moves links into head tag
Moves images to inside the empty div above them and removes background image styles obsoleted by how you added images in

Makes all images 100% of their containing element's width

Yup, that’s all you had wrong

Creates styles for flex header

Notes in code comments

Removes affected code

Removes floats and display: inline; plus adds and removes and bunch of
spaces to improve code readability

Implements custom scrolling effects

Adds scrolling scripts, adds back-to-top button and styles, changes
jQuery Slim to jQuery Core (to support animated scrolling, etc.) and
moves all script loading to up inside the </bod>y tag where they belong.
commit_list.repo_description: After making some major changes to the layout of my capstone project I thought it would be better to start from scratch to ommit any confusion during the coding process.

commit_list.message: Adds video to one card, adds video styles
Adds html for controls and js
Adds html for slides and images
Adds 3 more cards for the sake of it
Adds a slide indicator, adds text background

Button tweaks

Changes "more" button to “+”, removes border, sets hover effect
Moves JS to external file, embeds script in same location
Makes some more minor tweaks to color and links
Updates manuscript with new spellings for Metis and adds new section
Tweaks colors and bumps all font-sizes up by 1px
Adds modal grid and text-columns support
Adds original modals back in *GAR*, but using jQuery instead of JS for better browser compatibility

Revert "Adjusts modal styles for title and text column"

This reverts commit ea07d70a4387294e78502fac150f9768a62c1db4.

Revert "Merge branch 'jquery-modals'"

This reverts commit f10f4d89eaa0154ea9f1e916374919e6e3f2f601, reversing
changes made to ea07d70a4387294e78502fac150f9768a62c1db4.

Revert "Commits this to revert"

This reverts commit 4f86097d00651e0d0183fd85a426af8f37008d1a.
Adds in multiple modals and content for testing
Adjusts modal styles for title and text column
Swapped images around and added in styles for modal head
Adjusts typography on examples page and replaces hr styles on all pages
Adds and links all the rest of the pages
Fixes .lockup top padding on small sizes
Adjusts colors, fixes masthead, adds layouts and includes, styles .more-link
Adds a post explaining how I got Jekyll deployed on Heroku
Adds a makefile.rb to see if this resolves deployment issues
Makes a few updates to the post
Installs gems and needed files for rake and heroic
Adds ui kit page, new logo, new post, new navigation
Adds some posts and edits some more
Oops, forgot to uncomment a line in navigation.yml
OK, figured it out. I had the time set to an hour in the future and the post wouldn't appear.
Changes main nav items, and font style, plus increases font sizes across the site

Brings in _sass files for overrides and sets fonts

imports entire _sass dir from theme gem for purposes of overrides and
sets base fonts to Lato and Gentium, resets font variables to new
values.
Removes more italics and brings in _data/text.yml
Overwrites config files with theme defaults and customizes them
Updates logo, path and size, plus adds html template for customization
Adds a new post on basic Jekyll workflow
Makes a correction and adds a post on initial benchmarks
Adjusts .lockup placement and pagination default colors
Replaces Overview text with image and adds link titles
Animates wavelength and adds color scheme
Minor adjustments to wavelength and footer
Builds in basic nav toggle functionality
Adds and styles logo element and mobile nav toggle
Bumps up all font sizes slightly
Corrects font family in a utility class
Adds histories page and builds in navigation and pagination
Adjusts styles to account for new elements (page titles, buttons, etc)
Tries and fails to implement different scroll animation solutions without using jQuery

Adds support for smooth scrolling but requires adding jQuery

I DON’T want to have to use jQuery!
*sigh* ok, adds smooth scrolling with jQuery and back-to-top button
Gets the to-top button to hide on first page load
Comments .js file and adjusts when scroll button appears
Converts wave.svg to use view box, adds some histories material
Offloads page scripts into external file to improve the authoring experience and for eventual magnification
Pulls jQuery in favor of trying animate scroll.js
Adds examples.html and builds support for grid galleries
Adds cards text and minor styles
Revises gallery content, adds modal animation, changes icon animation to scale
Converts grid to better layout at various breakpoints
Adjusts trigram padding after live mobile test
Adds support for modals on gallery page
Makes minor tweaks to typography and color, re-styles and re-organizes pagination
Makes typographic improvements including drop caps, and begins work on manuscript
Pulled out colors and replaced with native css variables
Lays out the primary color scheme

Just playing around adding svgs to page scroll

Could easily use the window scroll function of the back to top button
to show divs as the page scrolls. Reveal is kinda bad when scroll is
animated . . . probably better to use stacked background svgs, but
implementation is a little iffy.
Slightly increases line lengths on wider screens
Changes link color for consistency with pagination

repo_list.description: After making some major changes to the layout of my capstone project I thought it would be better to start from scratch to ommit any confusion during the coding process.
A sample website demonstrating media cards with flexbox
a boilerplate wordpress theme for EID
a revision of the flexbox layout

A collection of CSS3 powered hover effects to be applied to links, buttons, logos, SVG, featured images and so on. Easily apply to your own elements, modify or just use for inspiration. Available in CSS, Sass, and LESS.
